author: JuliaRegistrator

comments.body:
Your `new package` pull request met all of the guidelines for auto-merging and is scheduled to be merged when the mandatory waiting period (3 days) has elapsed.

Since you are registering a new package, please make sure that you have read the package naming guidelines: https://julialang.github.io/Pkg.jl/dev/creating-packages/#Package-naming-guidelines-1



---
If you want to prevent this pull request from being auto-merged, simply leave a comment. If you want to post a comment without blocking auto-merging, you must include the text `[noblock]` in your comment.
<!-- [noblock] -->
<!---
this_is_the_single_automerge_comment
--->
It seems odd to register this package with no description at all of what it does?

I'm not sure if that's a question, but there is some description [here](https://github.com/MikeInnes/Mjolnir.jl/issues/1) which I'm in the process of turning into a readme. It's something of a base package for some other efforts like [this](https://github.com/MikeInnes/Poirot.jl) and [this](https://github.com/FluxML/XLATools.jl), which have some more description of what they do.
Can you please write a few descriptive sentences in the README, and also update the github 1-line repo description, so that a mystery package with no description doesn't show up on pkg.julialang.org?

@MikeInnes Can you retrigger Registrator? This will fix the merge conflict.

[noblock]
@MikeInnes, can you also update the "A little less conversation, a little more abstraction" one-line package description, since IIRC that is used for pkg.julialang.org?
By the way â€“ might be useful if these rules were written down somewhere. Otherwise it seems a bit ad-hoc.

I've created release `v0.1.0`, [here](https://github.com/MikeInnes/Mjolnir.jl/releases/tag/v0.1.0) it is.
<!-- dd2c7780-952c-11ea-9b47-b9e5fd7e535a -->
